module.name: dimension_tolerance
module.keywords: module, dimension, tolerance, angular, location, linear, plus, minus, limit, fit
module.purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of geometric dimensions of a shape and the direct application of tolerances to geometric dimensions.

inscope.li: specification of geometric dimensions of a feature of a shape;
dimensions that locate a feature relative to another feature;
specification of the value of a dimension;
dimensions that specify the size of a feature;The diameter of a hole is a dimension of size.The radius of a corner fillet is dimension of size.
specification of tolerances for geometric dimensions;
plus and minus tolerances applied to dimensions;

outscope.li: the presentation of dimensions and tolerances as annotations to the model or in a drawing.

(angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect <- {shape_aspect => derived_shape_aspect => extension} shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect shape_aspect_relationship => {shape_aspect_relationship.name = 'mirroring relationship'} shape_aspect_deriving_relationship)

(angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect <- {shape_aspect => derived_shape_aspect => perpendicular_to} shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect shape_aspect_relationship => {shape_aspect_relationship.name = 'positive normal'} shape_aspect_deriving_relationship)

(angular_location <= dimensional_location <= shape_aspect_relationship shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect -> shape_aspect <- {shape_aspect => derived_shape_aspect => perpendicular_to} shape_aspect_relationship.relating_shape_aspect shape_aspect_relationship => {shape_aspect_relationship.name = 'negative normal'} shape_aspect_deriving_relationship)
